chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Y Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 14CF1557; consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.  Obtain GED or HSED.
Vocational assessment. Participate in any programs recommended.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with George G.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.   The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to  and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements heard from State, Defense and Defendant.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 40 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 16 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, concurrent with  case number 14CF1557,  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 154 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-No contact with George G. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been resolved.

Defendant Eric Y Alexander in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Eric Y Alexander in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Eric Y Alexander not in court, in custody.  Jeremy Arn for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not produced from the House of Corrections.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Eric Y Alexander not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjournment of the plea hearing requested.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Telephone call from Attorney Vince Guimont indicating that the currently scheduled final pretrial date of 7/29/15 to convert to a projected guilty plea.  Matter rescheduled.  Notice given to the State to have defendant produced from the House of Corrections.
Received and filed with court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE FINAL PRETRIAL HEARING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, Defendant Eric Y Alexander not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Eric Y Alexander not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Eric Y Alexander not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review offer; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/28/2015 received and filed. (10 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Vincent Guimont, 819 North 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, WI, 53203.

Defendant Eric Y Alexander in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Eric Y Alexander in custody.  Ronald Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Fischer-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with George G. or his residence

Defendant Eric Y Alexander in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Eric Y Alexander in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

CASE RECALLED AT THE HOUR OF 2:22 PM.  ADA Ben Wesson appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled on Court's own motion.  Commissioner advised  DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4)

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
